meanings.definition: Grey: a color between black and white
meanings.sent1: The sky turned greys as the sun set.
meanings.sent2: She painted her room in calming greys.
meanings.sent3: The greys of the storm clouds made the day feel gloomy.
meanings.sent4: The greys of the old photograph hinted at a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The greys of the elephant's skin blended seamlessly with the rocks.

meanings.definition: Grey: a person with grey hair
meanings.sent1: Grandma's friend is one of the sweetest greys I know.
meanings.sent2: The actor portrayed a wise grey in the movie.
meanings.sent3: The greys at the retirement home always have fascinating stories to share.
meanings.sent4: The greys in the mirror reminded him of the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The greys in her hair added a touch of elegance to her appearance.

meanings.definition: Grey: to become grey in color
meanings.sent1: Over time, the walls in the old house greys.
meanings.sent2: The sky begins to grey as the storm approaches.
meanings.sent3: The paint started to grey after being exposed to the sun for too long.
meanings.sent4: His hair started to grey earlier than expected.
meanings.sent5: The once vibrant colors of the painting slowly began to grey.

meanings.sent1: The movie featured a mysterious group known as the greys.
meanings.sent2: In the story, the greys were said to have advanced technology.
meanings.sent3: The greys in the sci-fi novel were depicted as peaceful beings.
meanings.sent4: Many believe that encounters with the greys are just myths.
meanings.sent5: The greys in the film were portrayed as enigmatic and intelligent creatures.
